pullRequest.body:
- flip `LinearMap.convexHull_image` and rename to `image_convexHull`
- while at it, also flip the direction of `convexHull_smul` and `convexHull_neg` to match this

- fix argument order of `AffineMap.convexHull_image`: have the `AffineMap` argument come first; there's no good reason not to and this enables dot notation
- inline variable `(s : Set E)` to achieve this; this is slightly clearer anyway

[zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/image_convexHull.20vs.20convexHull_image)

---

nodes.body: maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8294244708/job/22698864931)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8294244708/job/22698864731)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8294244708/job/22698863998)
As stated on Zulip, the other direction is preferable to match other lemmas about maps of constructs along morphisms.
Should this lemma also be flipped?
Flipped now.
Should this lemma also be flipped?
Flipped now.

I think you can do better here
```suggestion
        using equivRealProdLm.toLinearMap.image_convexHull (s ×ˢ t)
```

That does not build:
```
type mismatch
  s ×ˢ t
has type
  Set (ℝ × ℝ) : outParam Type
but is expected to have type
  Set ℂ : Type```
Ah sorry. What if you replace the `s x t` argument by an underscore?

```
type mismatch
  h✝
has type
  ⇑↑equivRealProdLm '' (convexHull ℝ) ?m.5210 = (convexHull ℝ) (⇑↑equivRealProdLm '' ?m.5210) : Prop
but is expected to have type
  (convexHull ℝ) (⇑(LinearEquiv.symm equivRealProdLm) '' s ×ˢ t) =
    ⇑(LinearEquiv.symm equivRealProdLm) '' (convexHull ℝ) (s ×ˢ t) : PropLean 4
Feel free to tinker with and push a tweak yourself!

```suggestion
    convexHull ℝ (equivRealProdLm ⁻¹' (s ×ˢ t)) = equivRealProdLm ⁻¹' convexHull ℝ (s ×ˢ t) := by
```
